editModalOperationOnGoing: An operation is already ongoing for wallet {wallet} and exchange {exchange}
editModalNoRewardAvailable: No reward available for operation on this exchange.
editModalSelectExchange: Select the exchange to which you want to add wallet
editModalGainIfRemoved: Stake {stake_amount}, gain {gain_amount} if wallet {wallet} is successfully removed from {exchange}
editModalGainIfAdded: Stake {stake_amount}, gain {gain_amount} if wallet {wallet} is successfully added to {exchange}
editModalHolderEnterIdOrAddress: Enter a wallet id or one of its addresses
editModalLinkHeader: Clicking the link below will open your Obyte wallet, ready to send a transaction for the operation.
editModalLinkFooter: It will be taken into account a few minutes after the transaction is confirmed. Note that it could be canceled if in the meantime another user orders a similar operation. In this case, the AA will bounce the transaction to refund you.
editModalProofExplanation: Give at least one URL (beginning with http:// or https://) to support your claim. It can be anything but we suggest that you make a post on Reddit, Steemit, Medium, Bitcointalk, etc explaining your investigation.
claimModalLinkHeader: Clicking the link below will open your Obyte wallet, ready to send a transaction for claiming your gain.
claimModalLinkFooter: It will be taken into account a few minutes after the transaction is confirmed.
commitModalLinkHeader: Clicking the link below will open your Obyte wallet, ready to send a transaction for committing operation.
commitModalLinkFooter: It will be taken into account a few minutes after the transaction is confirmed.
contestModalGainIfReversed: Stake {stake_amount}, gain {gain_amount} if outcome is eventually reversed
contestModalLinkHeader: Clicking the link below will open your Obyte wallet, ready to send a transaction for the operation.
contestModalLinkFooter: It will be taken into account a few minutes after  the transaction is confirmed. Note that it could be canceled if in the meantime another user contests the operation. In this case, the AA would bounce the transaction to refund you.
contestModalTitleRemoving: Contest removing of wallet {wallet} from exchange {exchange}
contestModalTitleAdding: Contest adding of wallet {wallet} to exchange {exchange}
contributorsGreetingAdding: Thank you {author} for adding a new wallet to the exchange {exchange}! Thank you {sponsor} for sponsoring this!
contributorsGreetingRemoving: Thank you {author} for removing wallet from the exchange {exchange}! Thank you {sponsor} for sponsoring this!
contestModalProofExplanation: It's advised to provide a URL to support your contestation. It can be anything but we suggest that you make a post on Reddit, Steemit, Medium, Bitcointalk, etc explaining your investigation.
donateModalSelectExchange: Select the exchange for which your reward will apply
donateModalDonateAmountForAny: Donate {amount} for operation on any exchange
donateModalLinkHeader: Clicking the link below will open your Obyte wallet, ready to send a transaction for donating a reward.
donateModalLinkFooter: Your donation will be taken into account a few minutes after the transaction is confirmed.
setNicknameModalInstructions: Enter the nickname you want to link to your address.
setNicknameModalLinkHeader: Clicking the link below will open your Obyte wallet, ready to send a transaction for attributing a nickname to your address. This will only work if you use a single address wallet.
setNicknameModalLinkFooter: Your new nickname will be set a few minutes after the transaction is confirmed.
urlInputsOversized: Cannot be more than {max} characters, you should use a url shortening service like Bitly
urlProofModalProofForAdding: Proofs for adding wallet to exchange.
urlProofModalProofForRemoving: Proofs for removing wallet from exchange.
crowdSourcingMetaDescription: We use the counterstake protocol to crowdsource the identification of crypto exchange wallets.
crowdSourcingOperationsButtonContestTip: Challenge the current outcome by placing a stake on its opposite
crowdSourcingOperationsTableColOutcomeTi: Outcome that is going to win if no counterstake is placed
crowdSourcingOperationsTableColStakedOnO: Total staked on the winning outcome
crowdSourcingContributorsTableColInitiat: Number of times a contributor initiated an operation
crowdSourcingContributorsTableColSuccess: Number of times an operation initiated by a contributor were confirmed
crowdSourcingContributorsTableColIncomeT: Amount globally won or lost by initiating operations and/or counterstaking
rankingWelcomeMessage: These statistics are from on-chain activity at exchanges. The exchange's wallets identification is crowdsourced by users, who interact with an Obyte autonomous agent and earn rewards for their contributions.
rankingMetaDescription: Ranking of crypto exchanges based on their real activity tracked on the BTC blockchain.
rankingTableColReportedVolumeTip: Daily BTC trading volume reported by Coingecko
rankingTableColNbWithdrawalAddressesTip: Number of known withdrawal addresses for this exchange
rankingTableColNbAddressesTip: Number of known addresses for this exchange
rankingTableColTotalBtcWalletTip: Total BTC held by known exchange wallets
rankingTableColMonthlyTip: Sum of withdraws and deposits for one month
rankingTableColLastDayDepositsTip: Total BTC deposits made during the last 24 hours to known exchange wallets
rankingTableColLastDayWithdrawalsTip: Total BTC withdrawals made during the last 24 hours from known exchange wallets
rankingTableColTrendTip: Last week daily volume, click on preview for 1-year history
rankingGraphLegendWallets: Generated on {creation_date} UTC from aggregation of wallets:
explorerMetaDescription: Explore BTC chain by known wallets.
explorerTransactionsMetaDescriptionWalle: Bitcoin transactions involving wallet {wallet_id} belonging to {exchange}
explorerTransactionsMetaDescriptionTxId: Wallets and exchanges involved in Bitcoin transaction {tx_id}
explorerWelcomeMessage: You can explore the BTC blockchain here with transactions sorted by wallets or exchanges.
crowdSourcingWelcomeMessage: Help us to identify wallets used by exchanges and earn rewards.
faqMetaDescription: Everything about onchain activity ranking, wallet explorer and counterstake protocol.
faqAnswer1:
This website has 3 different parts.
  • 1: a wallet explorer that indexes BTC blockchain by wallets or group of wallets belonging to an exchange.
  • 2: a ranking of crypto exchanges based on their on-chain activity.
  • 3: a crowdsourcing page that is an interface to an Autonomous Agent running on Obyte. Counterstake protocol is the name of the mechanism that gives incentives to users that provide accurate identification of BTC wallets used by crypto exchanges.
faqAnswer2: Every hour, the BTC blockchain is analyzed to evaluate transactions going to and from wallets that supposedly belong to them. The statistics are not completely accurate, since activity from deposit addresses or addresses newly generated can be missing. Though not perfect, it provides good estimations about their real activity.
faqQuestion3: What is special about this explorer?
faqAnswer3: Our explorer groups addresses that are known to belong to the same wallet. All addresses presented here are inputs of transactions merged into a wallet. Wallets can also be merged when addresses that already belong to a wallet are seen as inputs of the same transaction. In this case the ID of the wallet that contains the most addresses is kept, while the other one is redirected. When a wallet is reputed to belong to an exchange, it is labelled as such, making life easy for those interested in monitoring transactions going to and from exchanges.
faqAnswer4: We rely on users to label wallets used by exchanges. Users interact with an Autonomous Agent directly from their Obyte wallet after having clicked a link that prefills data to be sent. All information displayed is read from AA state variables.
faqAnswer5: It's a consensus mechanism that aims to feed the Obyte ledger with accurate real world data. First rewards have to be donated by a sponsor, then an operation is initiated by a contributor. For this usecase, the operation is either adding a wallet to an exchange or removing the wallet to an exchange. This is expressed by a question that can be answered by YES or NO. The initiator sends {initial_stake} GB as stake and provides one or several URLs proving that the answer is YES. If it is convincing enough, the operation period goes to its end and the initiator receives his initial stake and the reward. If proofs are not convincing, one can challenge the position and stake Obyte Bytes on NO. If the amount on NO reaches {coeff}x the amount that is staked on YES, the outcome is reversed. The initiator would then lose its stake miss out on the reward, while the challenger would receive all the stake. It's always possible to inverse again the outcome by putting more Bytes at stake and reach {coeff}x the amount staked of the opposite. The challenge ends after {period} days without counterstaking. When several users stake on the same position, gains are shared pro-rata of their contribution.
faqAnswer6: Yes! Github-link. We hope it will inspire other developers to create cool application based on the counterstake protocol. If you want to contribute to this website please join the Obyte Discord to discuss your plans with us.
